description.narrative: (1) Promoting economic development in frontier provinces: The Project will directly improve access to finance in the frontier areas of Indonesia where Danamon is planning to expand its portfolio to SMEs. This will in turn drive innovation, economic growth, job creation, and poverty reduction. The strategic alliance between IFC and Danamon will help the Bank grow its SME portfolio and maintain Danamon''s position as the largest SME private player within the SME competition league. (2) Increasing SME access to long-term finance: The Danamon partnership in this Project will allow IFC to support the SME''s investment in fixed assets and other long-term financing needs. The market potential is challenging with 300,000 bankable SMEs needing access to financial services in Indonesia. Danamon plans to contribute towards reducing this unattended market demand by rolling out its SME expansion plan with its broader product offering.

The proposed investment consists of a debt facility to PT. Bank Danamon Indonesia, Tbk. (Danamon or the Bank), an existing IFC client, to support the Bank grow its lending activities to small and medium enterprises (SMEs). The proposed project will allow Danamon to continue strengthening and growing its SME portfolio. The proposed project is consistent with both IFCs Indonesia and financial markets strategy and roles to provide long-term financing to a bank that serves SMEs, in frontier regions of Indonesia and beyond the large cities as supported by Danamons widespread distribution capacity, and promote sustainable urbanization.

name.narrative: Danamon, headquartered in Jakarta, is the sixth largest bank (in terms of asset size) in Indonesia. As of June 30, 2013, the Bank has a network across Indonesia of around 3,350 branches, including among others conventional branches, micro outlets and Syariah units, as well as its subsidiaries branches. Danamons extensive network allows it to reach 850,000 micro and more than 60,000 SME customers in 2012. Currently, Danamon employes around 72,000 people, both in Danamon and its subsidiaries. The proposed investment will support the Banks growth strategy and increases its portfolio for SMEs in the fast-growing Indonesia banking system.
